case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy is brought in by his mother with reports of trouble at school. Teachers report that for the last 6 months he has been having difficulty finishing tasks, is easily distracted, frequently does not listen, commonly fails to finish schoolwork, has not been able to complete any of the class projects this year, and frequently loses school books and supplies. Teachers also say that he constantly fidgets, often leaves his seat without permission, has trouble being quiet, talks excessively, frequently interrupts his classmates when trying to answer questions, and has difficulty waiting in line. The mother states that she has also been noticing similar behaviors at home and that his symptoms have been affecting him negatively academically and socially. The patient has no significant past medical history. The patient is in the 90th percentile for height and weight and has been meeting all the developmental milestones. He is afebrile, and his vital signs are within normal limits. A physical examination is unremarkable.
question: Which  medications is a first-line treatment for this patient’s most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble finishing tasks, easily getting distracted, and I can't seem to sit still or wait in line.
How old are you?
I'm 5 years old.
Have you had any similar symptoms in the past, or is this the first time?
This is the first time; I haven't had any similar symptoms before.
Has anyone in your family been diagnosed with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)?
I don't know, nobody has told me anything about that.
Okay, thank you. Have you been taking any medications or supplements recently?
No, I haven't been taking any medications or supplements.
Thank you. Have you experienced any major life changes or stress recently?
No, nothing like that has happened.
**Final Diagnosis:** Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
